title: AI PROGRAMMER
description:
About the role

JCL Credit Leasing Sdn Bhd is seeking an experienced IT AI Programmer to join our dynamic team based in Kuala Lumpur. In this full-time position, you will play a crucial role in developing and implementing cutting-edge artificial intelligence (AI) solutions that will drive the company's digital transformation and enhance our service offerings to clients.
What you'll be doing
Design, develop, and implement robust AI models and algorithms to solve complex business problems
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into effective AI-powered solutions
Continuously optimise and refine AI models to improve performance and accuracy
Develop and maintain high-quality, efficient, and scalable AI-driven applications and services
Conduct thorough testing and debugging to ensure the reliability and integrity of AI systems
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in AI and machine learning
Mentor and train junior developers to expand the company's AI capabilities
What we're looking for
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field
Solid experience in AI/machine learning programming, preferably in a commercial environment
Proficient in programming languages such as Python, TensorFlow, and PyTorch
Strong understanding of AI algorithms, neural networks, and data preprocessing techniques
Experience in deploying and optimising AI models in production environments
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with a keen eye for detail
Able to join immediately

title: Machine Learning Engineer (Artificial Intelligence)
description:
We are seeking a highly motivated individual, the best of the bests talent to join our team as a Machine Learning Engineer (Artificial Intelligence). We welcome new graduates as well as experienced professionals who have the passion, curiosity, ability, and determination to be the best ML or AI engineer.
  Responsibilities:
Design, develop, and deploy machine learning models and algorithms for complex and unique datasets, using various techniques such as mathematical modeling, scikit-learn, NLP, CNN, RNN, DL, RL, Video Transformers, GAN, LLM, RAG, prompt engineering, GPT, AI Agent, Foundation Models, GPT, MCP, VLM, and VLA
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to extract insights, identify business opportunities and provide data-driven recommendations
Stay up-to-date with the latest machine learning and AI techniques and tools
Communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders in an easy-to-understand manner
 Requirements:
Bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, Actuarial Science, Informatics, Information Science or related fields
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Participation in Kaggle, Mathematics Olympiad or similar competitions is a plus
Excellent programming skills in Python, R, Java, or C++
Familiar with ML frameworks such as Tensorflow, Keras, PyTorch, MLFlow, AutoML, TensorRT, CUDA, HuggingFace, LangChain, LlamaIndex
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Experience with designing, training, and deploying machine learning models
Customer centric and committed to deliver the best AI results to customers
 As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will receive guidance from experienced senior AI specialists and have opportunities for professional growth and advancement within the company. We also encourage vibe coding.
 Possible future career paths after 2 years include Senior Machine Learning Engineer, AI Architect, AI Team Lead, Data Scientist, Data Architect, Data Lead, Research Engineer, Senior Research Engineer.
 Please note that this position is only for the best of the bests, and we expect candidates to have a strong mathematical background and the grit to solve complex problems. If you believe you have what it takes to excel in this challenging position, apply now.
 Fresh Graduates are also encouraged to apply!

title: Junior / Intermediate Data Analyst
location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
description:
Job Overview:
We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior or Intermediate Data Analyst to join our team in Kuala Lumpur City Centre. This role is ideal for recent graduates or early-career professionals who are passionate about using data to drive insights, build models, and support business decisions. The successful candidate will work closely with senior team members and cross-functional teams to analyze data, develop predictive models, and translate complex data into actionable strategies.
Key Responsibilities:
Collect, clean, and preprocess structured and unstructured data from various sources.

title: Data Scientist
company: Western Digital Tech and Regional Center (M) Sdn Bhd
description:
Job Description
Responsibilities
Work with data scientists, data engineers, software engineers, process & product engineers, design engineers, etc collaboratively to develop new data science solutions that improve productivity and operations metrics.
Researching and developing scalable Generative-AI solutions using AWS Bedrock platform, Large Language Models (LLM) and prompt engineering for factory/engineering usage
Deploy models and solutions using DevOps/MLOps tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, MLflow, AWS & Edge to ensure scalability and reproducibility.
Collaborate in cross-functional teams to integrate AI/ML algorithms, image analytics and software into the Analytics systems (including chatbot/AR/Computer Vision) as well as develop prototypes.
Design, develop, deploy and maintain Analytics Systems/solutions (Data engineering, Data Science, Chatbot, AI, Generative-AI, AR, Computer vision and Visualization/Web App) independently and delivered on time.
Meeting users, gathering user requirements and communicating requirements to a technical team member for technical solution design, feasibility study & planning.
Translate User Request into Analytics Solution from a system perspective. Prepare and deliver presentations with data visualizations and business conclusions.
Constantly learn new front tier technology and creatively apply/deliver solutions to manufacturing operations to meet KPIs.
Qualification
Masters or Bachelor Degree in Computer science, data science, computer engineering, information technology, or relevant work experience and education background.
We will also consider applicants with the equivalent combination of education, technical expertise, training, or work experience.
Preferably minimum 1-2 years of working experience in related field (Generative-AI & Chatbot).
Skills
Required: Python, LLM, Prompt Engineering, Chatbot, Generative -AI, Augmented Reality, Computer Vision
Added Advantage: Agentic AI and Multi-Agent architecture.  
Practical experience in application of ML and Deep Learning algorithms.
SQL, Relational databases, Big Data platforms, AWS Redshift, PRESTO, ETL, SSIS etc.
Some experience with web front end development: .NET, VB.NET, C#, HTML/CSS, JavaScript, NodeJS, JQuery & Angular
Ability to learn quickly and become productive on new technologies, APIs, development languages and frameworks.
Experience in data mining, data wrangling, and handling JSON, CSV files.
Hands on experience with Docker, Kubernetes, Edge computing and AWS.. etc
Experience with data visualization methods (Spotfire, PowerBI, Grafana)
The ability to problem solves and provide complex solutions with minimal supervision
Knowledge of Agile development, SCRUM and Application Lifecycle Management
Excellent communications and presentation skills, with the ability to synthesize, simplify and explain complex problems to different types of audience, including executives. A great team player.
Self-motivated, strong ownership and ability to work independently with minimal supervision
Additional Information
Western Digital thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. We are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution.
Western Digital is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. Please contact us at jobs.accommodations@wdc.com to advise us of your accommodation request. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.
NOTICE TO CANDIDATES: Western Digital has received reports of scams where a payment is requested on Western Digital’s behalf as a condition for receiving an offer of employment. Please be aware that Western Digital and its subsidiaries will never request payment as a condition for applying for a position or receiving an offer of employment. Should you encounter any such requests, please report it immediately to Western Digitals Ethics Helpline or email compliance@wdc.com

title: Data Analyst
description:
PURPOSE
Provide analytical modelling and solution to the Ipsos research/account team worldwide.
Guide, optimize study and questionnaire design for efficient analytics and cost management.
Drive the integration of new tools and innovative thinking in analytics to better meet client needs.
The role will require working closely with client service teams across all regions, The team members all are passionate, share a positive attitude, problem solving abilities and patience, enabling them to provide excellent customer service even during fast-paced shifts.
 ENVIRONMENT
Embark on an extraordinary career journey at Ipsos, where cutting-edge AI work seamlessly intertwines with our day-to-day operations. With a staggering global presence of 16,600 talented minds across 89 countries, we are one of the largest and best-known research companies. Join us on a quest for knowledge and innovation, where you'll have the privilege of collaborating with the most naturally curious researchers and making a profound impact on both local and global brands.
As a curious and intuitive individual, an enthusiastic professional fueled by a passion for knowledge creation, Ipsos beckons you to immerse yourself fully into finding the optimal solutions for our clients. Our environment is a fertile breeding ground for entrepreneurship and forward thinking, attracting like-minded professionals who possess drive, intelligence, and enthusiasm. Working at Ipsos is dynamic and challenging, never a dull moment!
 OUTPUTS/ACCOUNTABILITY 
Communicating with client service to understand data content, business and analysis requirement
Ability to break down and understand complex business problems, define a solution
Perform statistical modelling/analysis, with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, interpret and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy, and finally to prepare core deliverables or report (PowerPoint)
Ability to work independently, manage and monitor research projects from commissioning to delivery by utilizing well-developed project management skills, knowledge, deep insight and communicate skills.  Able to work under pressure and meet aggressive deadlines
Demonstrate strong supervisory skills, i.e. project delegation, time management, day-to-day feedback on performance and behavior, conduct performance reviews.
Keep abreast of current trends within market research, to develop personal skills / knowledge base and display specialist knowledge of a market and share this with others
Keenness to learn and proactive self-development and development of others
Assist with recruitment and couching of junior staffs
 COMPETENCIES 
Analytical/critical/forward thinking | Problem-solving | Decision-making | Communication Management | Project Management | Client Service/Focus | Achievement Oriented | Adaptability | Collaboration | Embracing Diversity | Nurturing Innovation | Proactive | Multi-tasking |Attention to detail | Curiosity
 RELATIONSHIPS
Effective interface with client service and project teams
Promote teamwork in the business area, Division and across Ipsos 
Lead by example and behavior (incorporating values) within the business area
Direct and manage the project team activities 
Behave in a manner that displays professionalism, integrity and corporate citizenship at all times
 DEVELOPMENT
Develop a good breadth of experience of different analysis techniques
Confidence and demonstrated capabilities & creativities in applying different tools, techniques and approaches
Demonstrate strong capabilities and leadership in one’s project, people and business management
Understanding of personal actions on business and client
 BACKGROUND
Experience:
At least 1 years of experiences in marketing data analytics/data science or similar fields
Understand and use statistical analysis 
Solid experience in project management
Bonus: Experienced in market research  
 Skills/Knowledge:
Statistical analysis and knowledge
Data manipulation
Analytical tools proficiency (eg. Microsoft Excel, SPSS, SAS are essential)
Programming languages - Python or R for data analysis and data visualization
Solid communication skills
Couching and mentoring skills
Bonus: Experienced in AI, machine learning and deep learning 
 Qualifications:
Degree in Data Science, Statistics/Mathematics, Business Analytics, Computer Science, Actuarial Science, Psychology, Social Science or related studies

title: Master Data Engineer - Fresh Graduates Required
description:

Proficiency in SQL, with advanced knowledge in data manipulation and data analytics tools (e.g., Pandas, NumPy).

Strong analytical, problem-solving, and critical-thinking skills, with the ability to derive actionable insights from complex datasets.

title: AI Research Intern
description:
About the role

We’re looking for a sharp, analytical, and tech-savvy AI Research Intern to help us explore the rapidly evolving landscape of AI tools and platforms. This is not just about playing with cool tech — it’s about asking the right questions, identifying real-world needs, and turning abstract technologies into clear, impactful use cases.

What we're looking for
Currently enrolled in a relevant university program, such as Computer Science, Mathematics, or Artificial Intelligence
Strong knowledge of machine learning, deep learning, and other AI techniques

If you're ready to join our dynamic team and make a meaningful impact, apply now.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description:
Company Introduction:
At SNSoft, we're at the forefront of technological advancement, integrating cutting-edge solutions into everyday life. Our culture thrives on innovation, collaboration, and a commitment to excellence. We foster an inclusive environment where every team member's contribution is valued and where everyone has the opportunity to grow.

 Benefits and Compensation:
Competitive salary range (MYR6,000- MYR10,000 per month, depending on experience).
Project Incentive (upon Company Declaration based on project performance)
Transport, Meal, Birthday Allowances (upon Confirmation)
Sports Activities (Badminton & Basketball), Company Outing
Training and certification sponsored by company (Selected employees).
Optical, Dental, Body Check Up Claim (upon Confirmation)

 Job Summary:
 As a Machine Learning Engineer, your responsibilities will include designing, developing, and deploying machine learning models and algorithms to address complex challenges and improve our products and services. Additionally, you will play a key role in AI-enhanced customer service. You will collaborate closely with data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts to implement state-of-the-art machine learning solutions.


Key Responsibilities:
Model Development: Design, build, and maintain scalable machine learning models and algorithms.
Data Analysis: Analyze and preprocess data from various sources to prepare it for model training.
Model Training & Evaluation: Train, validate, and tune machine learning models to achieve optimal performance.
Deployment: Deploy models into production and integrate them with existing systems.
Monitoring & Maintenance: Monitor model performance in production and update models as necessary to ensure they remain accurate and relevant.
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, software engineers, and product managers, to understand requirements and deliver solutions.
Research: Stay current with the latest developments in machine learning and AI to continuously improve our technology stack.

 Required Qualifications:
Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field.
Experience: Demonstrated at least 3 years experience as a Machine Learning Engineer or in a similar role.
Programming Skills: Expertise in programming languages such as Python, golang, or Java.
Machine Learning Frameworks: Proficient with machine learning frameworks and libraries like TensorFlow, PyTorch, JAX, scikit-learn, or equivalent.
Data Management: Strong understanding of data management and processing tools such as SQL, Hadoop, Spark, etc.
Problem-Solving: Exceptional analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Data Analysis Tools: Skilled in using data analysis and visualization tools like NumPy, Pandas, and Matplotlib.
NLP Experience: Familiarity with natural language processing concepts and large language models, including transformers and attention mechanisms.


Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced Education: Ph.D. in a relevant field.
Domain Knowledge: Experience in specific domains such as natural language processing (NLP), recommendation systems, computer vision, etc.
Big Data: Experience with big data technologies and distributed computing.
Cloud Services: Familiarity with cloud platforms such as AWS, Google Cloud, or Azure.
DevOps: Knowledge of CI/CD pipelines and tools for automating the deployment of machine learning models.

description:

title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
description:
🚀 Join CTRL CV: Empowering Industries Through Collaborative Innovation!
 At CTRL CV, we are more than just a company; we are a collaborative force driving industry-specific digital transformation. By combining collective expertise with cutting-edge AI technology, we deliver tailored solutions that tackle unique challenges across various sectors. Join us to be part of a culture that prioritizes innovation, continuous improvement, and client success. Together, we redefine possibilities and set new benchmarks for excellence.
 Role Description
We are seeking a visionary Artificial Intelligence Solution Architect who will serve as an Artificial Intelligence Engineer at CTRL CV. This role combines technical excellence with strategic thinking to design and implement AI-driven solutions from concept to deployment. You will lead efforts in understanding client needs, architecting innovative solutions, and ensuring their seamless integration into real-world applications. If you are passionate about bridging the gap between AI technology and practical business challenges, this is the role for you.
 Key Responsibilities
Solution Design: Architect and design AI-driven solutions that meet specific client needs, defining system requirements and end-to-end workflows.
AI Model Development: Build and refine advanced algorithms and models, focusing on areas such as pattern recognition, neural networks, natural language processing, and image processing.
End-to-End Implementation: Lead the deployment and integration of AI systems into existing infrastructures, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with developers, data scientists, and stakeholders to align technical efforts with business goals.
Client Engagement: Present complex AI concepts in a clear and actionable manner to clients and non-technical stakeholders.
Innovation and R&D: Stay updated with the latest AI advancements and integrate cutting-edge technologies into solution design.
System Integration: Oversee API design, cloud deployment, and infrastructure setup to ensure seamless implementation.
Project Oversight: Manage and prioritize multiple projects, ensuring timely delivery and client satisfaction.
 Qualifications
Solution-Oriented Expertise: Proven ability to design and implement AI systems with a focus on solution architecture and system integration.
AI Proficiency: Expertise in pattern recognition, neural networks, natural language processing, and image processing concepts and methodologies.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in frameworks like PyTorch and TensorFlow, and experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or GCP.
Educational Background: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, AI, or a related field.
Programming Expertise: Strong programming skills, particularly in Python, with a solid understanding of software development principles.
Data Insight: Experience in analyzing and interpreting complex data sets to inform model design.
Communication Skills: Ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to diverse audiences.
Project Management: Experience managing multiple projects simultaneously with a keen attention to detail.
Team Collaboration: Ability to thrive in both independent and hybrid team environments.
Passion for Innovation: A strong drive to explore and implement cutting-edge advancements in AI and solution design.
 Why Join CTRL CV?
 At CTRL CV, you’ll have the opportunity to shape groundbreaking projects that empower industries through collaborative innovation. As an Artificial Intelligence Engineer, you will take on the visionary responsibilities of a Solution Architect, designing and delivering impactful AI systems that redefine industry standards. Be part of a team that values creativity, knowledge-sharing, and excellence, and help us set new benchmarks for success.

title: Data Scientist (Artificial Intelligence)
description:
Why Join Us? 
At DCAP, we’re dynamic, fast-growing tech startup backed by Khazanah Dana Impak, providing AI-powered Consumer Financing Platform to hire purchase businesses. We don’t just offer jobs – we build careers. Step into a vibrant environment where your skills and ambitions will be recognized, nurtured, and rewarded.
 Key Features
Digitalized customer journey for partners.
Specialized support for vehicle purchase financing.
Commitment to serving underbanked and underserved populations.
 Our Culture
At DCAP, we embrace a "fail-fast" culture that encourages rapid testing of business scenarios. We value:
Bold ideas and innovation.
Continuous learning and adaptation.
Viewing failure as a crucial part of growth and improvement.
 Position Overview: Data Scientist (Artificial Intelligence)
We are seeking a talented Data Scientist specializing in Artificial Intelligence to join our dynamic team. This role blends advanced data science expertise with AI application development to drive the evolution of our AI-driven products. The ideal candidate will play a key role in advancing our mission to deliver inclusive financial solutions.
 Key Responsibilities:
Credit Risk Modeling and Analysis (≈50%)
Develop and refine alternative credit scoring models using machine learning techniques and non-traditional data sources.
Analyze diverse datasets to uncover patterns and trends in credit risk, particularly for underserved populations.
Collaborate with risk management teams to implement effective credit assessment strategies.
Create clear data visualizations and reports to communicate insights to stakeholders.
Enhance model performance through rigorous testing and validation.
Address ad hoc data analysis requests, delivering timely and actionable insights.
AI Solution Development and Integration (≈50%)
Design and develop AI applications to streamline operational workflows and boost business efficiency.
Implement and optimize Large Language Models (LLM) and Optical Character Recognition (OCR) solutions.
Optimize LLM models for improved performance and scalability.
Partner with software engineering teams to seamlessly integrate AI solutions into existing platforms.
Deliver rapid prototypes or proof-of-concepts to address time-sensitive AI challenges.
 Qualifications:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
1 to 4 years of experience in data science, with exposure to credit risk modeling and/or AI applications development.
Advanced proficiency in Python and SQL.
Expertise with machine learning frameworks (e.g. PyTorch, scikit-learn, or equivalent).
Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g. AWS) and containerization (e.g. Docker) is a plus.
Knowledge of LangChain and LangGraph is highly desirable.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with meticulous attention to detail.
Flexibility to manage multiple projects and meet tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
 Why You’ll Love This Role: 
VCs-Backed Startup: With the support of big and well-known investors, we’re positioned for long term success.
Work alongside experienced leaders and innovators: Who are passionate about cutting-edge technology.
Career Development: Be the pioneer key player in a collaborative environment.
Make a Real Impact: Your contribution will directly shape the future of our products and the financing industry.
Workplace: Accessible by public transport.
 Ready to jump-start your career and make an impact in finance? We invite you to apply now and be part of our exciting journey toward financial excellence!
Don’t worry if you don’t check every box – if you meet most of the criteria and are eager to learn, we’d still love to hear from you.

title: AI Annotator (Short Terms)
location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
description:
Role Overview: 
Data annotation is the process of labeling or curating data to train, tune, and/or evaluate AI models. This includes tasks like identifying objects in images, tagging pieces of text, or generating multiple-choice questions to support AI models that depend on high-quality labeled data for accuracy.
 3~6 months employment
Responsibilities:
Accurately label and tag data, including images and text, following provided guidelines.
Create clear and high-quality questions for educational or AI training purposes.
Review and verify annotations to ensure consistency and correctness across datasets.
Collaborate with other team members to ensure high-quality data outputs.
Assist in the development and refinement of annotation guidelines.
Maintain confidentiality and security of sensitive information.
 Skills and Qualifications:
Basic mathematical skills to understand complex concepts and work with technical data.
Excellent attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in English, especially for generating content and annotating text-based data.
Experience or familiarity with handling and processing various types of data is preferred.
Comfort with basic software tools, spreadsheets, or annotation platforms.
Ability to work independently, manage time effectively, and meet project goals in a remote work environment.

title: Software Engineer – Remote | Work with Australia’s Leading AI Company
description:
Location:
Remote (Malaysia)
Full-time | Approx. AUD $2,000/month (inclusive)
Includes 4 weeks paid leave + public holidays in your country
About Us
https://www.realtimetraffic.com.au
Real Time Traffic (RTT) is Australia’s leading AI and computer vision company for road safety. Our technology is deployed at hundreds of road sites across the country, working with government agencies to detect near-misses and reduce crash risks through real-time video and AI analytics.
We’re a fast-growing company backed by real-world impact and a mission to scale internationally within 2–3 years.
Why This Role Is Exciting
You’ll join a growing engineering team delivering AI/ML systems into production. This isn’t a lab experiment — we’re working with government partners across Australia on real, high-stakes projects.
You'll support our DevOps & ISO Lead, contributing to deployments that involve:
Camera-based machine learning applications
LLMs for automated analytics
High-volume video + traffic data processing
Secure cloud-based deployments (AWS)
Key Responsibilities
Package and deploy software and camera systems
Write automation scripts and tools
Assist with CI/CD pipelines and QA
Process large datasets for AI/ML pipelines
Troubleshoot technical issues for internal teams
Write maintainable, high-quality code (following SOLID principles)
Tech Stack
Python (pandas, numpy), JavaScript
MongoDB, AWS (Lambda, S3, Kinesis, EMR)
Git, Jupyter, Docker, Linux
OpenCV, LLM-based automation, ISO 27001 frameworks
What We’re Looking For
Degree in Computer Science or equivalent
1–3 years of hands-on development or support experience
Proficient in English (written and spoken)
Familiar with scripting, Linux, and cloud tools
Understanding of SOLID principles
Eager to learn, grow, and solve real-world challenges
What We Offer
Work remotely from anywhere in Malaysia
~AUD $2,000/month (inclusive of taxes/benefits)
4 weeks paid leave + local public holidays
Hands-on learning with modern tech (LLMs, AWS, computer vision)
Be part of a small global team making a real difference

title: Supply Chain Data Scientist
company: BASF Asia Pacific Service Centre Sdn Bhd
description:
Objectives of the position
Drive continuous improvement across the Asia Pacific Regional Supply Chain for Agricultural Solutions by leveraging data analytics to identify inefficiencies and implement data-driven solutions.
This role also leads digitalization and automation efforts, including data extraction, dashboard development in Power BI, and predictive analytics enablement.
Main Tasks
Advanced Analytics & Modeling
Develop predictive models for demand forecasting, inventory optimization, and lead time prediction.
Apply machine learning techniques (e.g., anomaly detection, planning data analysis) to large datasets to solve supply chain challenges.
Data Engineering & Automation
Manage and transform large datasets from ERP and planning systems (e.g., SAP).
Build automated data pipelines using Python, SQL, or similar tools.
Decision Support & Scenario Planning
Create simulation and optimization tools to support strategic planning and what-if analysis.
Monitor and refine models to ensure optimal performance.
Digital Supply Chain Projects
Lead or co-lead digital transformation initiatives (e.g., control towers, predictive maintenance, AI in logistics).
Collaborate with IT and data teams to enhance infrastructure and modeling capabilities.

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Operations Research, Industrial Engineering, Supply Chain, or related fields.
Minimum 3 years of experience in Supply Chain Analytics, Data Science, or quantitative modeling.
Proficient in Python or R; strong SQL skills.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., Snowflake, Azure, AWS) and machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow).
Familiarity with Supply Chain Planning and Execution Systems (e.g., SAP IBP, Kinaxis).

title: Data Engineer (Immediate & Hybrid)
location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
description:
Data Engineer - (Independent Contractor for 6-12 months) 
Are you a data-driven problem solver with a passion for building ETL pipelines, data infrastructure, and scalable data workflows? We’re seeking experienced Data Engineers to design, develop, and optimise data solutions that drive analytics, reporting and machine learning initiatives.
Your Role 
As a Data Engineer, you will design, build, and maintain ETL pipelines, data warehouses, and data lakes, ensuring high-quality data for analytics. You will collaborate with a team of data engineers to enable data-driven decision-making. 
Our client is a leader in the Oil & Gas sector, offering exposure to high-impact data projects in a dynamic environment. 
 Your Responsibilities 
Design and optimise ETL/ELT pipelines for structured and unstructured data. 
Build and maintain scalable data warehouses/lakes (Azure Synapse, Snowflake, etc.). 
Develop SQL queries, data models, and stored procedures for analytics. 
Implement data validation, cleansing, and quality checks. 
Support ML/AI workflows by preparing datasets for model training. 
Automate data processes using Azure Data Factory, Python, or Spark. 
Optimise data performance, cost, and scalability in cloud environments. 
Troubleshoot and resolve production data issues. 
 Requirements 
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, AI/ML, or a related field. 
1-5 years of experience in data engineering, ETL, or database management. 
Strong skills in: 
a. Python (data processing) 
b. ETL tools (Azure Data Factory, SSIS, Databricks, etc.) 
c. SQL (query tuning, data modeling, optimization) 
d. Power BI / DAX (Good to have) 
Attention to details, strong commitment to deadlines and data accuracy.
Strong communication skills, problem-solving skills and ability to work in a hybrid team. 
Resides in Klang Valley and will attend on-site meetings as required/needed. 
 Additional Information: 
Independent contractor role (no visa sponsorship available).

title: AI Engineer
description:
About the role

As an AI Engineer, you will develop agents powered by generative AI (LLM/SLM) and predictive or forecasting machine learning techniques. This role involves creating AI agents that automate workflows and deliver data-driven forecasts, enhancing decision-making and operational efficiency.
Key Accountabilities
AI Agent Development
• Design and implement AI agents using LLMs or SLMs for task automation, reasoning, and conversational interactions.
• Fine-tune and optimize language models for reliability, contextual understanding, and scalability.
• Train, fine-tune, and validate machine learning models for domain-specific tasks.
Predictive and Forecasting Machine Learning
• Design and implement predictive models and time-series forecasting systems to anticipate trends, user behavior, and operational metrics.
• Build and deploy machine learning models for predicting & forecasting key business indicators such as demand, revenue, and resource utilization.
• Integrate forecasting outputs into AI agents to enable proactive and adaptive decision-making.
System Integration & Deployment
• Deploy & Integrate AI agents with enterprise business systems, APIs, and data pipelines ensuring efficiency, scalability, and secure deployment.
• Optimize data pipelines and infrastructure for efficient agent performance.
• Implement monitoring, evaluation, and continuous improvement of AI models in production environments.
Collaboration & Strategy
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align AI solutions with business goals.
• Identify opportunities for AI adoption and prototype new use cases.
Optimization & Ethics
• Monitor agent performance post-deployment, addressing bottlenecks and updating models.
• Ensure ethical AI practices, including bias mitigation and compliance with relevant regulations.
Requirement
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in computer science, AI, Data Science, or related field.
Strong proficiency in Python and ML frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, LangChain, or Hugging Face Transformers to ability to code end to end AI agents using traditional python coding.
Familiar and exposed to AI coding assistants / Vibe coding (e.g. Cursor, Grok, Trae)
Proven experience in AI agent development, generative AI, and language model fine-tuning (LLMs/SLMs).
Strong expertise in predictive analytics and forecasting machine learning, including time-series modeling and deployment.
Familiarity with retrieval augmented generation (RAG) or autonomous AI Agent frameworks including multi-agent systems.
Experience in deploying AI agents in domain specific (construction, finance, or enterprise settings).
Knowledge of AI ethics frameworks and regulatory compliance.
Experience with cloud platforms (Azure) and containerization technologies is and added value.

title: Machine Learning Engineer (Artificial Intelligence)
company: Agensi Pekerjaan The Supreme HR Advisory Sdn Bhd
description:

title: Executive - Business Analytics
description:
Duties & Responsibilities
As a Business Analytics Executive, you will be a key player in our organization, driving transformative initiatives in data analysis, data engineering, and/or machine learning. Your primary responsibility will be to gather business intelligence from diverse sources, analyze complex datasets, and formulate strategic recommendations to drive business growth and enhance operational efficiency.

Transform data into reusable analytics assets – datasets, reports, pipelines, and notebooks – in the curated layer of the Lakehouse and Data Warehouse.

In Microsoft Fabric:
Ingest data with shortcuts, pipelines, or dataflows.
Transform data with dataflows, procedures, and notebooks.
Store data in the Lakehouse and Data Warehouse.
Build reusable data models, and maximise the value of data through visualization and reporting in Power BI.

Job Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) or equivalent.
1-2 years of proven experience in business intelligence, data analytics, and data engineering roles. Fresh graudates are welcome to apply.
Strong commercial awareness with expertise in data analysis, visualization, stakeholder management, and a sound understanding of data engineering principles, ETL concepts, and data modeling.
Experience with role-based access control (RBAC), data security, and governance.
Must be willing to be based at HQ, Shah Alam.
Candidates with the following certifications have advantage:
- Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate
- Microsoft Certified: Fabric Analytics Engineer Associate (preferred)

title: Artificial Intelligence Engineer
description:
We are seeking passionate AI Engineers to join our team in building high-performance AI systems that drive productivity, automation, and personalization. You will work on the full lifecycle of AI solutions — from prototyping and training to deployment and optimization — while collaborating closely with our backend team.
We welcome applications from both experienced professionals and new graduates who have completed relevant AI projects and are eager to contribute.
Responsibilities
As an AI Engineer, you will assist us in the following:
Integrate AI models into web, mobile, or backend applications using APIs or edge runtimes.
Research and experiment with state-of-the-art models (e.g., LLMs, Transformers, RAG) and build scalable pipelines for production use cases.
Optimize performance of locally hosted open-source models for real-time or batch inference (focus on latency, memory, and accuracy).
Monitor and debug model behavior in production — including drift, hallucinations, and performance degradation — and maintain model-serving architecture in a Linux environment.
Develop and implement AI projects across domains including:
Natural Language Processing (NLP)
Machine Learning (ML)
Computer Vision using OpenCV
Speech Recognition & Synthesis
Business Process Automation
Enterprise Document AI Assistants
Conversational AI / Chatbots
Key Qualifications
Proficient in Python and core AI/ML libraries: TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn, Transformers, etc.
Hands-on experience with NLP, computer vision, or generative AI (e.g., ChatGPT, LLaMA, DALL·E, open source models).
Familiarity with RAG pipelines and vector databases (e.g., Qdrant,  FAISS).
Comfortable working in Linux environments and optimizing GPU-based inference.

title: T&T - Amplify Program Technology & Transformation - Malaysia
description:
Company description:

"Deloitte" is the brand under which tens of thousands of dedicated professionals in independent firms throughout the world collaborate to provide audit & assurance, tax & legal, strategy, risk & transactions, technology & transformation and related services to select clients.

These firms are members of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited, a UK private company limited by guarantee ("DTTL"). Each DTTL member firm provides services in particular geographic areas and is subject to the laws and professional regulations of the particular country or countries in which it operates.


Job description:

Are you ready to Amplify your career?
At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve.
We're committed to building an inclusive and supportive environment where your ideas are valued, your growth is encouraged, and your work creates real impact.
The beginning of your career should be shaped by meaningful experiences and the Amplify Programme is designed to provide just that: real work, personalised support, and the opportunity to grow professionally with purpose.
We're looking for final-year students graduating by September 2025, or recent graduates (2022-2025) with less than three years of work experience, ready to kick-start their careers in professional services.

Work you'll do
As a Graduate and Industry Intern in our Technology & Transformation team, you will gain hands-on experience in delivering comprehensive solutions to support our clients transformation agenda. This one of our portfolio offerings below:
Cyber: Help clients swiftly adapt to evolving markets, new threats, and disruptive competition through comprehensive cybersecurity assessments, penetration testing, development of robust cybersecurity frameworks, cloud security solutions, data protection strategies, and advanced threat intelligence. Click here to find out more!
Engineering, AI & Data, Operations, Industry & Domain Solutions: Harness the power of cloud engineering, data analytics, and AI to modernize systems, implement cutting-edge technology, and drive innovation and performance. Focus on cost-effective, efficient operations that fuel profitable growth by leveraging state-of-the-art cognitive and digital solutions to reduce costs, maximize efficiency, transform payments and revenue processes, and embrace emerging business models. Click here to find out more!

Enterprise Technology & Performance: Unlock maximum value from digital transformation investments with innovative strategy, design, implementation, and optimization of enterprise systems and software. This holistic approach to performance improvement and digital transformation enhances business processes and achieves operational excellence. Click here to find out more!
Customer: Craft and implement digital marketing strategies rooted in data-driven, creative, customer-centric approaches that capitalize on digital innovation, advertising, and a human-first vision. This ensures the creation and retention of engaged customers, powering sustained growth for our clients. Click here to find out more!

Human Capital: Empower organizations through HR transformation solutions, workforce optimization, and future human capital planning. Help them navigate change, build resilient and future-ready teams, and manage organizational change effectively. Click here to find out more!
Who We're Looking For
We're looking for aspiring professionals who are eager to explore a career in a dynamic and fast-paced professional services environment.
Eligibility:
Final-year students who will graduate from an accredited university by September 2025
Recent graduates from 2022 to 2025 with less than 3 years of full-time work experience who would like to explore a career in advisory and technology consulting services
Master's Degree or Bachelor's Degree background in business, finance, accounting, human resource, computer science, computer engineering, information systems and technology or other related fields
Ideal candidates will also demonstrate:
Team player with effective interpersonal and communication skills
Exceptional problem-solving ability. Logical reasoning, creative thinking, comfort with numbers, and the ability to untangle complex issues.
Strong passion for consulting, ability to adapt and cope in a fast pace, challenging work hours and environment
Fluent in verbal and written English
Got what it takes to Amplify your career, apply now!

title: Data Engineer (RMI)
description:
About the Role
We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Data Engineer to join our team! This role involves working with large volumes of data, building and maintaining data pipelines, and supporting the transition to automated processes that improve efficiency and data accuracy.
Job Definition
 Perform data cleaning, processing, and ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) from various sources into data storage systems.
Ensure data quality through proper planning and implementation.
Maintain and document data pipelines, processes, and infrastructure.
Monitor and troubleshoot data issues to ensure timely resolution.
Extract data from online sources to support analytical needs.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand and address data requirements.
Support automation of data-related processes and systems.
Provide training and guidance on the use of automated workflows.

Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, or a related field.
Strong experience with SQL, MongoDB, and a solid understanding of Relational and Non-Relational databases.
Proficient in Python and comfortable with other scripting languages.
Familiarity with Microsoft Excel, PowerPoint, Word and Power BI / Power Automate.
Basic understanding of HTML & CSS.
Experience in web scraping using tools like BeautifulSoup, Selenium, or Scrapy.
Knowledge of AWS or Azure is an added advantage.
Interest or experience in the automotive industry is a plus.
Excellent communication skills in English.
Strong teamwork, coordination, and learning abilities.
Self-motivated, disciplined, and able to work well under pressure.
Logical thinker with attention to detail.

We're looking for 5 Data Engineer in Chennai and 5 in Kuala Lumpur to join our growing team.

title: Junior Business Analyst
description:
Overview
Join our diverse, focused team in the Growth Department, where we research and implement innovative systems to drive business growth. As part of our digital transformation, we have established pipelines to extract, transform, and analyse big data. We are now looking to enhance our modeling and analysis capabilities to drive strategic pricing decisions across departments—from product sourcing to packing and delivery.
 Key Responsibilities
Data Sourcing: Expand our global database by sourcing data and developing standard operating procedures to digitise it for internal use.
Data Analysis & Reporting: Generate detailed reports from sales, review, and invoice data to summarise pricing actions for products, advertisements, and shipping.
Business Analysis: Conduct market reviews, particularly in the automotive sector, to identify opportunities and challenges, transforming findings into actionable insights.
Modeling & Analysis: Prototype and backtest pricing models and analytical tools using Python and Excel.
Collaboration: Partner with various departments to understand their needs and design integrated solutions that align with their workflows.
Systems Development: Develop full-stack solutions that support data sourcing and enrichment through statistical, visual, and machine learning techniques.
 Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a technical field (e.g., Finance, Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics).
1–2 years of experience with Python and Excel, including statistical or econometric analysis.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to succinctly summarize insights and propose actionable solutions.
Strong organizational skills and the ability to work effectively across diverse functional areas.
 If you are excited to leverage data and technology to drive strategic pricing decisions, we’d love to hear from you!
 Benefits 
Travel Allowance 
Health Allowance 
Food Allowance

title: Data Scientist, Financial Conglomerates Supervision
description:
ROLE PURPOSE:
Execute the SupTech and Data Analytics Unit (SDA) projects through the development and deployment of advanced analytics methods that extract insights from financial institutions’ data to pre-empt emerging risks and facilitate effective continuous supervisory function.
PRINCIPAL ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Develop and deploy innovative data analytical tools for supervisors to effectively monitor and identify emerging issues, vulnerabilities, and risks, enabling pre-emptive supervisory actions/interventions.
Collaborate with other departments such as Digital & Technology Sector and Data Management & Statistics Department to develop and realize data analytics tools.
Support and contribute to deliver outcomes under the Supervision sector's SupTech project.
Facilitate / assist in inherent risk profiling and ongoing surveillance of significant activities of financial institutions, escalating insights to internal stakeholders for further analysis and intervention.
Work with relevant parties to streamline data definition, collection and usage by supervisors, ensure consistency and minimizing duplication in reporting by financial institutions.
Oversee the timely and accurate backend processing of granular data submitted by financial institutions for use in data analytics.
Provide ongoing technical support to supervisors for the effective use of data analytics tools and collaborate with department learning officers to enhance supervisors' competency in using these tools.
Maintain appropriate data access management including setting permission, auditing access and liaising with the relevant departments or approving authority for data analytics tools in accordance with the Bank's information security guidelines.
 QUALIFICATIONS:
Academic Qualifications: Master / Bachelor Degree or professional qualifications in Data Science/AI, Information Technology, Computer Science, Accounting, Economics, Banking, Finance, Risk Management, or equivalent with a minimum CGPA of 3.00 and above or Second Class Upper.
At least 2 years of prior working experience in data analytics, data science or related field.
TECHNICAL SKILLS/ KNOWLEDGE:
Knowledge
Excellent understanding of statistical and technical methods, and knowledge in data management, visualisation and machine learning
Technical/Functional Skills
Applied statistical skills, with sound understanding of distributions and methods of statistical inference.
Programming skills in languages commonly used in data science (e.g. R, Python, SQL) and computing knowledge (added advantage)
Strong project management and analytical skills.
Experienced in Microsoft Excel, PowerBI and SAS EG.
Skilled in end-to-end data science workflow from data sourcing, wrangling, modelling, evaluation, and deployment
ONLY SHORTLISTED CANDIDATES WILL BE NOTIFIED

title: Data Analyst
location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
description:
Job Responsibilities:
1. Foster a collaborative and innovative team culture to drive excellence in data analysis.
2. Evaluate large data sets with advanced statistical methods (like Azure Machine Learning) to model predictive results.
3. Maximise data capabilities by building data lakes and historical analysis and ensuring data integrity and security for analytics, exploration, and characterisation.
4. Research and continuous development of algorithms to predict sales and customer behaviours using real time Point of Sales, CRM and ERP and other unstructured data sources.
5. Develop downstream analytics solutions for Operations, Finance and Marketing through using data visualisation tools such as Power BI to assist business in KPI tracking, automate/improve processes.
6. Able to extract insights and employ best-in-class data visualisation and analytics practices to enable effective decision making.
7. Test the solution with real live data & present the results and provide strategic recommendations to senior management.
8. Define and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for the Data Team.
9. Regularly assess and report on team performance, identifying areas for improvement and implementing corrective actions.

10. Demonstrate strong leadership qualities, including the ability to motivate and lead a team towards success.
11. Possessing outstanding communication proficiency in both written and verbal forms, with the ability to present complex information in a clear and understandable manner.

title: Data Engineer (Immediate & Hybrid)
location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
description:
Data Engineer - (Independent Contractor for 6-12 months) 
Are you a data-driven problem solver with a passion for building ETL pipelines, data infrastructure, and scalable data workflows? We’re seeking experienced Data Engineers to design, develop, and optimise data solutions that drive analytics, reporting and machine learning initiatives.
Your Role 
As a Data Engineer, you will design, build, and maintain ETL pipelines, data warehouses, and data lakes, ensuring high-quality data for analytics. You will collaborate with a team of data engineers to enable data-driven decision-making. 
Our client is a leader in the Oil & Gas sector, offering exposure to high-impact data projects in a dynamic environment. 
 Your Responsibilities 
Design and optimise ETL/ELT pipelines for structured and unstructured data. 
Build and maintain scalable data warehouses/lakes (Azure Synapse, Snowflake, etc.). 
Develop SQL queries, data models, and stored procedures for analytics. 
Implement data validation, cleansing, and quality checks. 
Support ML/AI workflows by preparing datasets for model training. 
Automate data processes using Azure Data Factory, Python, or Spark. 
Optimise data performance, cost, and scalability in cloud environments. 
Troubleshoot and resolve production data issues. 
 Requirements 
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, AI/ML, or a related field. 
1-5 years of experience in data engineering, ETL, or database management. 
Strong skills in: 
a. Python (data processing) 
b. ETL tools (Azure Data Factory, SSIS, Databricks, etc.) 
c. SQL (query tuning, data modeling, optimization) 
d. Power BI / DAX (Good to have) 
Attention to details, strong commitment to deadlines and data accuracy.
Strong communication skills, problem-solving skills and ability to work in a hybrid team. 
Resides in Klang Valley and will attend on-site meetings as required/needed. 
 Additional Information: 
Independent contractor role (no visa sponsorship available).

title: Data Engineer
description:
PRIZM Group is a global agency with specialisation in digital marketing, social media, big data, and eCommerce with over 200 staff in 5 offices including Hong Kong and Singapore. The group’s expertise lies beyond a mere digital solution but synchronizing MarTech and Creativity to empower the formation of seamless digital experience. In 2022, PRIZM Group was crowned the prestige overall Agency of the Year hosted by Marketing Interactive.
To cope with our rapid growth of HQ, we are setting up our team in Malaysia. We are seeking for English & Cantonese speaking candidates with high calibre to join our new team in Malaysia within an extremely innovative and exciting digital marketing company.

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated data engineer to join our data team. The ideal candidate should have strong knowledge in building data infrastructure and engineering solutions using modern data technologies.
Responsibilities:
Collaborate with professional service teams to identify clients' business problems for data pipeline building.
Build scalable data pipelines and infrastructure using modern data technologies such as Databricks, dbt, etc.
Develop and implement ETL processes to extract, transform, and load data from various sources into our data warehouse.
Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to ensure data accuracy, completeness, and availability.
Continuously evaluate and incorporate new technologies and tools to optimize data engineering processes.
Requirements:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Big Data, or related field.
Proficiency in Python.
Proficiency in SQL. Experience in No-SQL database is a plus.
Familiarity with building large-scale, distributed systems on cloud platforms such as AWS, GCP, or Azure.
Experience in data engineering, data warehousing, database design, and data integration.
Experience in big data technologies such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka.
Experience in container technologies, such as Docker/Kubernetes.
Ability to work independently.
Excellent communication skills in English and Mandarin to effectively communicate with our diverse client base and stakeholders.. Cantonese is a plus.
At least 2 years of working experience in the related field is required
Candidates with more than 3 years of experience will be considered for the senior position
We offer attractive compensation package to suitable candidates. Interested parties, please click "Apply Now" to submit your application including your present & expected salary.
(Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.)

title: Data Analyst
description:
Benefits of this role:
13th Months Salary (upon Company Declaration)
Project Incentive (upon Company Declaration based on project performance)
Transport, Meal, Birthday Allowances (upon Confirmation)
Sports Activities (Badminton & Basketball), Company Outing
Training and certification sponsored by company (Selected employees).
Rewards and recognition: Long Service Award / Best Performer Award / Role Model Awards etc
Medical Insurance (upon Confirmation)
Optical, Dental, Body Check Up Claim (upon Confirmation)
 Job Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and talented Data Analyst to join our Data and Analytics team. As a Data Analyst at SNSOFT， you will play a critical role in helping us understand player behaviour, optimize game performance, and drive informed decision-making across the organization. If you are passionate about gaming and have a strong analytical mindset, we invite you to apply and be a part of our exciting journey.
 Key Responsibilities:
Data collection and processing: 
Collect data from multiple sources, including internal databases, public datasets, APIs, and more.
Clean and preprocess data for analysis. This includes handling missing values, outliers, and formatting data.
Describe a clear requirement for data engineers to build data pipeline
Data analysis:
Analyze data using statistical methods and models to extract useful information or insights.
Conduct descriptive statistical analysis, exploratory data analysis (EDA), hypothesis testing, etc.
Data Visualization: 
Use charts, graphs, and dashboards to present data analysis results so that non-technical people can understand the insights behind the data.
Create interactive reports and dashboards using tools like Tableau, Power BI, Google Data Studio, and more.
Report preparation and presentation:
Write analytical reports and present analytical results to support business decisions.
Work with the team and management to interpret the results of data analysis and provide recommendations based on the data.
Cross-department collaboration:
Work with different departments to understand business needs and customize data analytics projects based on those needs.
Support the data needs of marketing, sales, finance and other teams.
Data Quality Assurance: Ensure data accuracy and integrity by implementing data validation processes and quality checks.
 Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related discipline). Advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in the gaming industry.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, or R.
Strong data visualization skills using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with statistical analysis and A/B testing methodologies.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to present complex data findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to work independently as well as part of a team.
Passion for gaming and a deep understanding of gaming mechanics and player behaviour is a plus.

title: BI Analyst
description:
We are looking for a skilled Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst to join our team. The BI Analyst will be responsible for analyzing data to provide actionable insights, support strategic decision-making, and optimize business performance. The candidate will play a key role in delivering data-driven recommendations to enhance customer experience, maximize revenue, and improve operational efficiency.
 RESPONSIBILITIES
Analyze large data sets from various sources, including customer behavior, product performance, and financial metrics, to identify trends and opportunities.
Develop, maintain, and enhance dashboards and reporting tools to visualize data and track key performance indicators (KPIs).
Work closely with stakeholders, including marketing, operations, and product teams, to provide data insights that support strategic business decisions.
Monitor and evaluate customer activity, including churn rates, customer segmentation, and lifetime value (LTV) to inform marketing and retention strategies.
Identify opportunities for optimization in product offerings, customer acquisition, and retention strategies.
Perform ad-hoc analysis to answer business questions, troubleshoot performance issues, and suggest improvements.
Collaborate with data engineers to ensure accurate data collection, storage, and retrieval.
Present findings and recommendations to management in clear and concise reports or presentations.
Assist in forecasting models, predictive analytics, and other advanced data techniques to enhance decision-making.
 SKILLS
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong analytical skills and ability to interpret complex data sets.
Strong communication skills with the ability to present data-driven insights to non-technical stakeholders.
 REQUIREMENTS
Advanced/Higher/Graduate Diploma, Bachelor's Degree, Post Graduate Diploma, Professional Degree in Data Science, Business Analytics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 2 - 4 years of professional experience in BI.
Experience with data warehousing and ETL processes is a plus.
Proven experience as a BI Analyst.
Proficiency in data visualization tools such as Tableau, Metabase and Power BI.
Strong SQL skills and experience working with databases to extract and analyze data.
Familiarity with statistical tools and methods for data analysis and modeling is a plus.
Ability to manage multiple projects and deliver accurate results in a fast-paced environment.
 BENEFITS
5 Working days
Casual (e.g. T-shirts)
EPF & SOCSO
Team Buildings
Plenty of Coffee & Snacks
Annual and medical leave
Performance Bonus
Open, Friendly, and Positive Working Environment

title: Data Scientist
company: Western Digital Tech and Regional Center (M) Sdn Bhd
description:
Job Description
Responsibilities

Skills
Required: Python, LLM, Prompt Engineering, Chatbot, Generative -AI, Augmented Reality, Computer Vision

SQL, Relational databases, Big Data platforms, AWS Redshift, PRESTO, ETL, SSIS etc.

Excellent communications and presentation skills, with the ability to synthesize, simplify and explain complex problems to different types of audience, including executives. A great team player.

Additional Information
Western Digital thrives on the power and potential of diversity. As a global company, we believe the most effective way to embrace the diversity of our customers and communities is to mirror it from within. We believe the fusion of various perspectives results in the best outcomes for our employees, our company, our customers, and the world around us. We are committed to an inclusive environment where every individual can thrive through a sense of belonging, respect and contribution.
Western Digital is committed to offering opportunities to applicants with disabilities and ensuring all candidates can successfully navigate our careers website and our hiring process. Please contact us at jobs.accommodations@wdc.com to advise us of your accommodation request. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.
NOTICE TO CANDIDATES: Western Digital has received reports of scams where a payment is requested on Western Digital’s behalf as a condition for receiving an offer of employment. Please be aware that Western Digital and its subsidiaries will never request payment as a condition for applying for a position or receiving an offer of employment. Should you encounter any such requests, please report it immediately to Western Digitals Ethics Helpline or email compliance@wdc.com

title: Data Centre Operations Engineer (Shift)
description:
Job Purpose:
To provide efficient, effective technical support to both internal and external customers, Telco’s vendor, suppliers, contractors with the objective of coordinating, managing, solving their problems in a minimal time frame and providing post-sales technical support to all AIMS customers
Technical competency as Level-1 on Structured Cabling System & DC Infrastructure (non-power relation)
To provide customer service in order to establish and maintain a strong relationship with customers
To ensure all related operations activities are performed in compliance with company standards, processes, regulations and procedures
Coordinate and act as a single point of contact within the engineering team, customers, Providers, Vendors & Contractors by support, maintenance, troubleshooting to customers covering AIMS’ Products & Services of operations matters for all Data Centre sites of AIMS.
 The Work Life:
Technical competent to detect & identify the defects and deficiencies which inclusive of Isolation, troubleshooting, restoration and rectification of DC Infrastructure services.
Responsible to carry out and manage day-to-day support & operational matters and function of Data Centre Operations (DCO) Engineer.
To perform escalation as per DCO processes and procedure during service problem/outages Notify Higher Level of Escalation / Management of incidents in a timely manner. To do escalation to other Department/unit such as within Engineering team, Sales during outages if required

Fresh graduates with Degree in Bachelor of Telecommunications / Networking are encouraged to apply
Skilled in troubleshooting method and high self esteem
Proactive with lots of initiative and ability to make decisions and have creative problem solving ability
Dedicated and passionate about learning new skills
Able to work on Shift hours

title: Business Intelligence Analyst
description:

title: Executive - Business Analytics
description:
Duties & Responsibilities
As a Business Analytics Executive, you will be a key player in our organization, driving transformative initiatives in data analysis, data engineering, and/or machine learning. Your primary responsibility will be to gather business intelligence from diverse sources, analyze complex datasets, and formulate strategic recommendations to drive business growth and enhance operational efficiency.

Transform data into reusable analytics assets – datasets, reports, pipelines, and notebooks – in the curated layer of the Lakehouse and Data Warehouse.

In Microsoft Fabric:
Ingest data with shortcuts, pipelines, or dataflows.
Transform data with dataflows, procedures, and notebooks.
Store data in the Lakehouse and Data Warehouse.
Build reusable data models, and maximise the value of data through visualization and reporting in Power BI.

Job Requirements
Bachelor's Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, or Mathematics (STEM) or equivalent.
1-2 years of proven experience in business intelligence, data analytics, and data engineering roles. Fresh graudates are welcome to apply.
Strong commercial awareness with expertise in data analysis, visualization, stakeholder management, and a sound understanding of data engineering principles, ETL concepts, and data modeling.
Experience with role-based access control (RBAC), data security, and governance.

- Microsoft Certified: Power BI Data Analyst Associate
- Microsoft Certified: Fabric Analytics Engineer Associate (preferred)

title: Junior / Intermediate Data Analyst
location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
description:

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented Junior or Intermediate Data Analyst to join our team in Kuala Lumpur City Centre. This role is ideal for recent graduates or early-career professionals who are passionate about using data to drive insights, build models, and support business decisions. The successful candidate will work closely with senior team members and cross-functional teams to analyze data, develop predictive models, and translate complex data into actionable strategies.
Key Responsibilities:
Collect, clean, and preprocess structured and unstructured data from various sources.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, correlations, and key insights to support business objectives.
Build and evaluate predictive models using machine learning techniques for forecasting and classification tasks.
Collaborate with business teams to define analytics needs and deliver data-driven solutions.
Performance monitoring and debugging of deployed models.
Document analytical processes, model assumptions, and data handling workflows.
Contribute to the development of data models to support business strategy.
Stay up-to-date with the best practices in analytics, statistical modeling, and data science.

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a creative approach to tackling technical challenges.
Proficiency in using data manipulation and plotting libraries (e.g., pandas, matplotlib, seaborn, scikit-learn).

Strong communication skills, with the ability to present complex analyses in a clear and concise manner.

title: Data Engineer
description:

 Job Responsibilities:
Designing, building, and optimizing data pipelines and ETL processes to efficiently extract, transform, and load data from various sources into our data warehouse.

 What we offer:

title: Cloud Consultant (Google Workspace)
location: Kuala Lumpur City Centre, Kuala Lumpur
description:
Overview:
We are seeking a dynamic and highly motivated Cloud Consultant with expertise in Google Workspace to join our growing team. This role is open to both Junior and Mid-Seniority candidates, offering an exciting opportunity to work with cutting-edge cloud technologies and directly impact our clients' success.
As a Cloud Consultant, you will play a pivotal role in guiding clients through their Google Workspace journey, from initial strategy and design to successful implementation and adoption. You will be instrumental in demonstrating how Google Workspace, including powerful tools like AppSheet for low-code application development and Gemini (Google's AI model) for enhanced productivity and automation, can revolutionize their operations.
Responsibilities
For All Seniority Levels:
Engage with clients to understand their business challenges, objectives, and existing IT infrastructure.
Advise on best practices for Google Workspace adoption, configuration, and security.
Plan and execute seamless migrations of data and applications to Google Workspace.
Provide training and support to end-users and administrators.
Stay up-to-date with the latest Google Workspace features, updates, and related Google Cloud technologies.
Collaborate with our sales, technical, and project management teams to ensure client satisfaction.
For Mid-Seniority Candidates (in addition to above):
Lead discovery workshops and architectural design sessions with complex clients.
Develop comprehensive implementation strategies and project plans.
Design and implement custom solutions leveraging Google Workspace APIs, AppSheet for bespoke applications, and integrating Gemini to automate workflows or enhance data analysis.
Provide advanced technical troubleshooting and solution optimization.
Mentor junior consultants and contribute to internal knowledge sharing.
Act as a trusted advisor to clients, guiding them on long-term digital transformation roadmaps.
Develop and deliver comprehensive training programs for various user groups.
Drive change management initiatives to ensure smooth adoption of Google Workspace solutions.
For Junior Candidates:
Assist senior consultants in data migration, configuration, and support tasks.
Learn and apply best practices for Google Workspace implementation.
Support user training and documentation efforts.
Develop foundational knowledge in AppSheet and explore use cases for Gemini within Google Workspace.
Actively participate in client engagements, gaining hands-on experience.
Qualifications
Required:
For Junior Position: A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business, or a related field, OR equivalent practical experience. Fresh graduates with a strong demonstrable interest and aptitude for cloud technologies and digital transformation are encouraged to apply.
For Mid-Seniority Position: 3+ years of experience in a technical consulting, implementation, or support role, preferably with cloud productivity suites.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a client-centric approach.
Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work independently and as part of a collaborative team.
Preferred (Any combination of the following is highly valued):
Google Workspace Expertise: Hands-on experience with Google Workspace administration, including Gmail, Drive, Meet, Docs, Sheets, Slides, and Google Sites.
Microsoft 365 Technical Experience: Technical experience with Microsoft 365 (e.g., Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, Teams, OneDrive) and an understanding of migration pathways to Google Workspace.
Automation & Digital Transformation Experience: Experience in automating business processes, implementing digital transformation initiatives, or working with low-code/no-code platforms.
AppSheet Knowledge: Familiarity with AppSheet for developing mobile and web applications, including data sources, logic, and UI/UX design.
Gemini Awareness: An understanding of AI/ML concepts and a keen interest in how Gemini can be leveraged within Google Workspace for content generation, summarization, analysis, and automation.
Google Cloud certifications (e.g., Google Workspace Administrator, Associate Cloud Engineer) are a plus.

title: Data Understanding Specialist - Arabic Market - Kuala Lumpur
description:
About the role

We're looking for a talented Data Understanding Specialist to join our team at TikTok Pte. Ltd. in Kuala Lumpur. As a key member of our data analytics group, you'll play a vital role in driving insights and understanding for our Arabic market. This is a full-time position with opportunities for growth and development within our dynamic, global organisation.
What you'll be doing
Analysing complex data sets to uncover meaningful insights and trends for our Arabic-speaking audience
Translating data into actionable recommendations to support business decision-making and strategy
Collaborating cross-functionally with product, marketing, and operations teams to address data-driven challenges
Developing and maintaining reporting dashboards and visualisations to effectively communicate findings
Staying up-to-date with the latest data analytics tools, techniques, and industry best practices
Sharing knowledge and mentoring more junior members of the data team
What we're looking for
Minimum 3 years of experience in data analysis, with a strong background in working with large, complex data sets
Proficiency in SQL and data visualisation tools like Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Excellent problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with the ability to derive insights from data
Familiarity with data mining, statistical analysis, and machine learning techniques
Strong communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to effectively present data-driven insights
Fluency in Arabic and English, with the ability to understand cultural nuances and preferences
A degree in a quantitative field, such as statistics, data science, or computer science
What we offer

At TikTok, we're committed to creating an inclusive and supportive work environment that empowers our employees to thrive. We offer competitive salaries, generous benefits, and opportunities for professional development and growth. You'll also enjoy a range of wellness initiatives, social events, and the chance to work alongside a talented, diverse team of passionate individuals.
About us

TikTok is a leading global platform for short-form mobile videos, empowering and inspiring creativity and joy. We are committed to building a future where expression, community, and connection thrive. Join us in our mission to bring joy and inspire creativity in people's lives.
Apply now to become our next Data Understanding Specialist - Arabic Market - Kuala Lumpur!
