● Take ownership of complex ETL tasks and AWS Lambda functions.

● Guide junior team members in testing practices and setting up automated tests.

● Proficiency with AWS
● Experience with PostgreSQL and/or OpenSearch.
● Strong SQL skills demonstrated through past roles and projects.
● Experience implementing and improving CI/CD pipelines for ETL processes.
● Solid understanding and several years of experience working with Python in a production environment.

title: Data Engineer
description:
Key Responsibilities
1. Design, build, and maintain scalable and reliable data pipelines.
2. Integrate data from various sources, including APIs, relational databases, and NoSQL databases.
3. Ensure data availability and quality across data warehouse, data lake, and lakehouse environments.
4. Optimize ETL/ELT processes and data pipelines for maximum performance and efficiency.
5. Ensure data replication processes between systems or environments run correctly and efficiently.
6. Collaborate with data analysts and data scientists to deliver clean, usable data and actionable insights.
7. Communicate effectively with principals and external stakeholders in English, particularly for system integration, troubleshooting, and technical documentation.
8. Maintain data security and ensure compliance with company policies and standards. 
Qualifications
1. Proven experience as a Data Engineer, Data Analyst, or in a related role.
2. Proficient in both spoken and written English (required for communication with international partners).
3. Strong understanding of APIs (REST, SOAP, or GraphQL).
4. Proficient in SQL and at least one programming language, preferably Python.
5. Solid knowledge of relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and/or NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB, Redis).
6. Familiar with Big Data concepts and tools such as Hadoop, Spark, or Kafka.
7. Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure), particularly in data-related services such as BigQuery, Redshift, or Snowflake.
8. Understanding of data warehouse, data lake, and lakehouse architectures.
9. Experience managing or monitoring data replication between systems or environments.
10. Capable of performing data maintenance, optimization, and profiling.
11. Experience with data integration tools (e.g., IBM, Informatica, Qlik Replicate, etc).
Additional Value
1. Experience with data workflow orchestration tools (e.g., Airflow, etc).
2. Familiarity with CI/CD practices for data pipelines.
3. Knowledge of data governance and data quality best practices.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
About the role
As one of the prominent fintech players in Indonesia, Amartha provides financial services to underbanked women entrepreneurs in rural areas. We firmly believe that financial inclusion is key to building a sustainable economy that uplifts and supports the entire country.
We are currently seeking a Junior Data Scientist to join our team. In this role, you will apply your skills in data wrangling and advanced problem-solving to tackle real business challenges. You will collaborate with a diverse range of stakeholders, including business experts, product leaders, and tech-savvy engineers.
You’ll also work alongside a team of exceptional data scientists with varied expertise, spanning data engineering, machine learning and AI engineering, data warehousing, and data analysis.
At Amartha, we value your mindset and adaptability even more than your technical prowess.
Responsibilities
Develop and maintain data engineering services as a part of the big data ecosystem in Amartha
Develop data engineering framework to simplify the day-to-day data science works
Collaborate with the data science, product, and engineering teams to build a product solution with integrated analytics and/or machine learning systems
Research the latest data and ML/AI engineering tools and frameworks that can potentially be implemented to improve the status quo
Influencing the data-driven culture to the company
Requirements
A Bachelor’s / Master's degree in engineering or quantitative fields
Proficient in setting up basic networking in a cloud system
Proficient in DevOps best practices such as CI/CD or IAC
Proven expertise in using Docker and Kubernetes
Familiar with common data engineering tools (Airflow, dbt, Spark, etc.)
Previous experience in implementing end-to-end machine learning in production is a plus
Previous experience in building scalable real-time analytical solutions is a plus
Proficient in tackling ambiguous problems with clarity and a structured framework
Ability to simplify and clearly communicate complex concepts to non-technical persons
Ability to seamlessly and effectively communicate from strategic to operational levels
Strong resolve in facing uncertainties and new challenges
At Amartha, we are dedicated to creating a workplace that celebrates diversity, ensures equity, and fosters inclusion. We believe that diverse perspectives—shaped by factors such as gender, age, race, ethnicity, education, culture, and life experiences—drive innovation and growth.
We actively welcome individuals from all backgrounds to join us in building an environment where everyone feels respected, valued, and empowered. Our commitment is to provide equal opportunities and foster a sense of belonging that enables our employees to thrive and make meaningful contributions.

title: Project Document Controller (English Speaker)

responsibilities include managing project documentation and budget allocation, ensuring efficient executive office operations, and fostering a productive work environment.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Office Management, or a related field.

3–5 years of experience as a Project administrator / Document controller or in a similar secretarial/administrative support role.

title: Tender Coordinator
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE
We are seeking an organized and efficient Tender Coordinator to join our Regional Tender Unit team in Egis’ Jakarta Office. In this role, you will provide crucial coordination and administrative support to our Business Development and Tendering Department, ensuring smooth operations and contributing to the success of our bidding processes. This role focuses on managing administrative tasks related to our tender processes, ensuring smooth coordination and efficient workflow.
KEY RESPONSIBILITY

Tender Coordination
Upstream Business Intelligence: Monitor and follow up on project forecasts and tender advertisements through regular client and information website searches. Gather, purchase and share to relevant stakeholders the EOI/RFP documentation.
Commercial Data Entry: Handle data entry tasks and maintain up-to-date records in commercial databases and maintain the centralized bid register to track ongoing and past bids.
Third Party Due Diligence: request and search information to analyze third-party risk under the management of the Regional Ethics & Compliance Manager.
Participate in Business Development Meetings, take notes, and follow up on actions with Business Developers and Country Managers.
As part of the Bid Team, under the leadership of the Bid Manager and alongside the Proposal Engineer, showcase Egis's qualifications in Expressions of Interest and prepare winning Technical and Commercial Proposals as part of the Bid Team:
Administers the EOI/tender process, including recording correspondences and letters, Tender documentation and management approvals records.
Along with the Proposal Engineer, review the client’s requirements, establish the document preparation tracker, noting all requirements, formats and documentation necessary. Ensure all tasks are correctly assigned with a clear deadline and update the tracker progress regularly.
Be responsible for the marketing and administrative part of the proposal, ensuring documents meet client and Egis quality standards.
Interact and coordinate with internal (HR, Ethics & Compliance, Legal, Tax & Finance, ESG) or external partners to obtain the requested information.
Plan formatting, publishing, and printing requirements. Act as a timekeeper to ensure deadlines are met.
Prepare, compile and submit the EOI & tender documents, ensuring accuracy and completeness.
Assist in the preparation of client presentations based on submitted proposal.
Regional Administrative Support
CV Database Administration and Validation: Transfer existing Egis staff CVs and Freelance network on the CV database.
Reference Database Management and Validation: Transfer completed project references to the Reference Database, ensure data accuracy and validate the project references with Project Managers.
Knowledge Management: Compile submitted content for easy reuse such as Marketing or Technical Methodology Content.
WHAT WE NEED FROM YOU
Bachelor’s degree in business administration, or a related field (preferred).
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English & Indonesian (mandatory).
5-10 years of administrative experience, preferably in a Business Development or Tender department.
Knowledge of business development environment (preferred).
Experience with tender documentation and processes (preferred).
Experience with Indonesia tender systems (preferred).
Experience with International Financial Institutions (World Bank, Asia Development Bank, etc) (preferred)

title: Supply Chain Managemet
description:
REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelor’s degree in any major (preferably in Industrial Engineering, Logistics, Management, or other relevant fields).
Minimum 3 years of experience in Supply Chain Management.
Experience in handling export-import documents is highly preferred.
Open to both male and female candidates.
Fluent in English, both spoken and written (MANDATORY).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Used to working with various internal and external stakeholders.
Communicative, open, and able to coordinate effectively across teams.
Capable of working both strategically and operationally in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
Able to create and interpret supply chain data analysis reports, and familiar with lean methods / lean testing.
Proficient in using ERP systems, AutoCount, and other relevant supply chain support tools is a plus.
ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES (SUPPLY CHAIN MANAGEMENT)
Supply Chain Planning & Management
Plan material and product requirements based on sales forecasts and production planning.
Manage the inbound and outbound flow of goods efficiently from suppliers to warehouse and/or customers.
Procurement & Vendor Management
Source, evaluate, and establish cooperation with competent vendors and suppliers.
Negotiate pricing, delivery schedules, and payment terms.
Prepare and maintain contracts with logistics partners and suppliers.
Logistics & Distribution Management
Oversee domestic and international shipping processes.
Ensure timely delivery, cost efficiency, and quality control of goods.
Responsible for warehouse management, including stock monitoring and inventory accuracy.
Export-Import Documentation & Customs Compliance
Prepare export-import documents such as invoices, packing lists, bill of lading, certificates of origin, etc.
Ensure all export-import activities comply with customs regulations and local government policies.
Supply Chain Performance Monitoring
Create and analyze supply chain KPI reports, such as lead time, on-time delivery, accuracy, and cost efficiency.
Develop and implement strategies to improve supply chain efficiency.
Cross-Department Coordination
Collaborate with sales, procurement, finance, production, and logistics teams to ensure product availability and smooth distribution.
Act as a liaison between internal teams and external parties such as vendors, distributors, shipping companies, and port authorities.
System & Process Development
Develop and implement more efficient and measurable work systems and processes.
Actively involved in digitalization and optimization of the supply chain operations.

title: Safety Officer
description:
A brilliant career opportunity has arisen for an experienced Safety Officer to work for Godrej Indonesia. Godrej Consumer Product Limited (GCPL), an India-based company, acquired the PT Megasari Makmur group (now operating as PT Godrej Consumer Products Indonesia) engaged in home care in 2010. GCPI has now grown into a leading Home and Personal Care company in Indonesia, with factories located in Bogor and Bekasi. GCPI is committed to fostering an inclusive work environment where individuals of all ethnicities, social background, age, religion, gender, also people with disabilities are welcomed and empowered to express themselves.
GCPI's flagship brands includes HIT in the household insecticide category, Stella in the air freshener category, and Mitu in the baby care and baby wipes category which are all market leaders in their respective categories. GCPI's brand portfolio also includes other household favorites such as NYU, Proclin, Biosol, Klinpak, Polytex, Carrera, Cap Gajah, Shock, Saniter, all popular brands that can be found in most Indonesian households.
By applying to Godrej Consumer Products Indonesia, you agreed on our Personal Data Protection Policy means that your data will be used for recruitment purpose only. Your data will be stored for a certain period determined by the Company. https://www.godrejindonesia.com/privacy
Key Responsibilities:
Conduct regular safety inspections of work areas, tools, equipment, and practices to ensure compliance with health and safety regulations.
Develop, implement, and monitor safety programs, procedures, and policies.
Identify potential hazards and recommend corrective actions.
Investigate workplace accidents, incidents, and near-misses, and prepare reports with findings and recommendations.
Ensure proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE) by employees.
Maintain and update safety documentation, such as Job Safety Analysis (JSA), Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), and incident reports.
Provide safety training and awareness programs for employees.
Promote a safety culture across all levels of the organization.
Qualifications:
Diploma or Bachelor’s Degree in Occupational Health and Safety, Engineering, or a related field.
Certified in Occupational Safety (a government-issued K3 certificate is a plus).
Minimum 1–2 years of experience in a safety-related role, preferably in manufacturing
Strong knowledge of occupational health and safety laws and regulations.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Attention to detail, proactive mindset, and strong analytical skills.
Willing to go for 6 months contract, placement is in Gunung Putri, Bogor

title: Data Engineering Leader
description:
Responsibilities:
Define and lead the data transformation strategy across business domains (sales, finance, production, SCM).
Align data initiatives with enterprise architecture, data governance, and analytics strategy.
Establish and enforce data modeling, ETL/ELT standards, and documentation practices.
Ensure reusability, scalability, and maintainability of data solutions.
Ensure data consistency, integrity, and availability for analytics.
Collaborate with functional data to understand domain-specific requirements.
Drive performance optimization and standardization of data processing practices.
Coordinate delivery across technical teams and ensure compliance with data governance policies.
Requirements:
Education: Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Information Systems, or a related field; Master’s degree is a plus.
Work Experience
Minimum 8+ years of experience in data roles engineering, data management, or analytics, with at least 3 years in a leadership or managerial role.
Proven experience leading end-to-end data transformation projects, including the design and maintenance of ETL pipelines across complex data environments.
Strong track record of working with cross-functional teams, aligning technical solutions with business needs, and ensuring adherence to data governance and quality standards.
Hands-on experience with data platforms (e.g., Snowflake, SAP BW/HANA, Oracle, SQL Server), ETL tools (e.g., Informatica, Talend, DBT), and familiarity with cloud data ecosystems is preferred.
Experience in BI Tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Qlik Sense is a plus.
Skills
Technical skills:
Strong proficiency in SQL and advanced database management.
Extensive knowledge of ETL processes and data warehousing.
Fluent in English (written and spoken).
Advanced experience with data modeling and data visualization techniques.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python is advantageous.
Soft skills:
Leadership:
Strong project management skills with an ability to handle multiple priorities.
Proven ability to translate business language into data requirements.
Analytical Thinking:
Exceptional ability to analyze complex data and provide profound insights.
Strong business acumen and understanding of business processes.
Attention to Detail: High level of accuracy and meticulous attention to detail.
Problem-Solving: Advanced problem-solving skills and critical thinking ability.
Communication Skills: Excellent communication (verbal and written) and stakeholder management skills. Strong presentation and collaboration skills.
Team Collaboration: Ability to lead and work effectively within a team and across departments. Strong organizational skills, ability to multitask, and adaptability to change.
Professional Development: Commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest BI trends and technologies.
Profiency in English Language (both written and spoken).

title: Data Engineer (Azure Data Factory)
description:
Responsibilities:
Developing and managing data pipelines solutions for the organization
Develop and execute database queries and conduct analyses
Generate reports, dashboards, and visualizations to present findings to stakeholders and support data-driven decision-making
 Requirements:
Strong English communication skills; interviews and meetings will be conducted in English.
Willing to work on-site at the South Jakarta office.
Bachelor’s degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum 2 years of hands-on experience in data engineering.
Solid knowledge of ETL processes, data warehousing, and data engineering best practices.
Proficient in Azure Data Factory, Snowflake, Python, MS SQL, and stored procedures.
Experienced in data migration across various systems and sources.
Skilled in using BI tools, especially Power BI.
Familiarity with SAP CPI, SNPGlue, and BizTalk is a plus.
Proven ability to develop and manage data integration between systems or external parties.
 Why join Us?
We offer very attractive salary and outstanding benefits.
Most of our clients are multinational company which you will be exposed to a large IT environment and valuable experience in international scale projects.
You will always learn new things as our projects always adopt latest technology and best practice available in the market.
Last but not least, we offer a supportive and encouraging environment that puts the emphasis on teamwork. Here, your soft skill (professional relationships, character, attitude) will grow as fast as your technical skill.

title: Lead Data Engineer
description:
Get to know our Team
At GrabFin, we empower the people of Southeast Asia, from consumers and drivers to every-day entrepreneurs, by ensuring financial inclusion for the underserved. The team is building solutions by enabling our partners (i.e. drivers and merchants) to get access to financial services (lending and insurance) products for their everyday needs.
Get to know the Role
We are seeking a visionary Lead Data Engineer to join our innovative team in Jakarta, Indonesia. As a key member of our data engineering department, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining our data infrastructure to support critical business decisions and drive organizational growth. This position will be reporting to Manager.
The Critical Tasks You Will Perform
Architect and develop robust, scalable data pipelines to ensure seamless data flow across multiple systems
Optimize data processing workflows for enhanced performance, scalability, and reliability
Establish and enforce data governance policies to maintain data quality, integrity, and regulatory compliance
Implement advanced security measures to protect sensitive data and ensure data privacy
Design and refine data models that support both analytical and operational use cases
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide innovative solutions
Mentor and guide junior data engineers, conducting regular code reviews and providing constructive feedback
Monitor data systems, implement automated alerting solutions, and resolve issues to ensure high availability and performance
Stay current with industry trends and emerging technologies in the data engineering field

title: Data Specialist (Engineer/Scientist/Governance)
description:

title: Data Scientist
description:
About Us
99 Group is a leading real estate technology company that operates real estate portals across South East Asia, specializing in digital property advertising. Headquartered in Singapore, it is currently operational in Singapore and Indonesia and employs over 500 employees. In Singapore, 99 Group operates 99.co and SRX.com.sg, while in Indonesia, it operates 99.co/id and Rumah123.
Join Us and Lead the Real Estate Revolution!
We are looking for a junior-level data scientist who is equally comfortable writing SQL queries and ML models as they are stepping into a room with stakeholders to solve business problems. This person will be learning the ropes to be a go-to data consultant for internal teams — from product managers to the CEO — helping them make data-driven decisions, build experiments, and uncover strategic opportunities.
What You'll Be Doing:
Collaborate with business stakeholders to deeply understand problems and design data-backed solutions.
Perform ad hoc analysis, report, A/B test evaluation, and causal inference when needed.
Develop, test, and deploy machine learning models in production (e.g., demand forecasting, pricing models, recommendations etc.).
Generate data visualizations and dashboards to communicate insights clearly.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define business problems and translate them into data solutions.
Act as a data partner to stakeholders — translating complex questions into analytical plans, and results into actionable recommendations.
Stay updated on latest tools, techniques, applications and best practices in data science and machine learning.
What We're Looking For:
Strong SQL skill and using Python for software engineering, data wrangling and ML-modelling.
Familiar with libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, TensorFlow or other similar ML/DL libraries.
Strong understanding of statistical modeling, hypothesis testing.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills — able to translate data insights into business impact.
Are you ready to shape the future of real estate? Join us in this exciting journey of innovation, collaboration, and growth. Together, let's redefine what's possible in the world of real estate.
Make your mark at 99 Group. Apply now!

title: Assistant software Engineer - Intern (Paid Internship)
description:
About the position

Join our team at HITHINK TECHNOLOGY INDONESIA as an Assistant Software Engineer - Intern (Paid Internship). This is a full-time internship position based in South Jakarta, Jakarta, offering you the opportunity to develop your skills and gain valuable experience in a dynamic, fast-paced technology environment.
What you'll be doing and What we're looking for
Main Responsibilities: 
Assist in developing software systems according to project requirements for Japanese clients, including but not limited to programming code writing, unit module testing, system integration testing, etc.
Educational Requirements:
Full-time undergraduate or master's degree graduates of the class of 2025
Majors related to science and engineering, such as computer science, software engineering, big data, cloud computing, Internet of Things, network engineering, information, communication, electronics, etc.
Required Skills: 
Proficiency in at least one programming language, such as Java, VB.NET, C, COBOL, etc.
Language Requirements: 
English level 4 or above, with the ability to communicate in writing or verbally with Indonesian colleagues in English; Or Japanese N3 or above, with the ability to read Japanese documents, students who are able to communicate with Chinese language are welcome too.
Other Requirements: 
Decent attitude, no criminal record, excellent academic performance, eligibility for graduation and degree certificates, willingness to engage in software development work, ability to handle work pressure, attention to work quality, and a responsible attitude towards job responsibilities.
Work Location: Jakarta, Indonesia.
Job Responsibilities:
Coding: Under the guidance of others, complete the code writing and defect modification of simple modules.
Testing: Under the guidance of others, complete the writing of the unit test project table and unit testing for simple modules.
Training and Guidance: Participate in training related to development languages and basic development processes.
If you're ready to embark on an exciting and rewarding journey as an Assistant Software Engineer - Intern, we encourage you to apply now!

description:

title: Lead Data Analyst
description:
About the role

PT Tawada Healthcare is seeking an exceptional Data Analyst to join our dynamic team in West Jakarta. As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in extracting, analysing and interpreting complex data sets to drive informed business decisions and creating strategic dashboards for the company's Business Development & Strategy purposes.
What you'll be doing
Collect, organise and analyse large data sets from multiple sources
Develop and implement data models and reporting dashboards to provide actionable insights
Translate data into meaningful and understandable reports and presentations
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and solve business challenges
Stay up-to-date with the latest data analysis tools and techniques
Continuously improve data quality, processes and workflows
What we're looking for
Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or a related discipline
Minimum 5 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role
Proficient in data manipulation, analysis and visualisation using tools such as SQL, Python, Excel, Tableau or Power BI
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to drive insights from complex data sets

title: Data Analyst
description:
Key Responsibilities:
1. Analyze sales trends, channel performance, and distributor data across regions and product categories.
2. Identify growth opportunities and underperforming areas based on quantitative insights.
3. Design, build, and automate dashboards and sales performance reports using Excel, Power BI, Tableau, or similar tools.
4. Assist with demand forecasting and sales planning by using historical data and predictive models.
5. Support the sales team with insights for setting targets and territory planning.
6. Track product availability, stock turnover, and order fill rates at distributor and retail levels.
Qualifications:
1. Bachelor’s degree in Business Analytics, Statistics, Economics, Data Science, or a related field.
2. Min 2 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a trade sales or commercial environment.
3. Proficient in Excel (pivot tables, VLOOKUP, advanced formulas), and experienced with BI tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
4. Strong SQL skills and familiarity with ERP/CRM systems (SAP, Oracle, Salesforce) is a plus.
5. Solid understanding of sales KPIs, trade marketing concepts, and retail distribution.
6. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
7. Ability to present complex data in a clear, actionable format.
8. Strong communication skills to engage with both technical and non-technical teams.

Provide data-driven recommendations to management to drive strategic decision making
Stay up-to-date with the latest data analysis tools and techniques to continuously improve processes
What we're looking for
D3 qualification in a relevant field such as Information Technology, Computer Science or Data Analytics
Proficient in data analysis tools and techniques, including SQL, Excel, and data visualisation software
Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills with the ability to interpret data and draw meaningful insights
Excellent communication and presentation skills to effectively convey data-driven insights to stakeholders
Familiarity with production processes and an understanding of manufacturing operations
Attention to detail and a keen interest in continuous improvement
What we offer

At PT Panasonic Gobel Energy Indonesia (PECGI), we are committed to providing a rewarding and fulfilling work environment. You will have the opportunity to contribute to the growth and success of our organisation, while benefiting from:

- Competitive remuneration package
- Comprehensive health and welfare benefits
- Opportunities for professional development and career advancement
- Collaborative and supportive team environment
If you are ready to embark on an exciting data-driven journey with us, we encourage you to apply now.

title: Data Analyst
description:
About us :
YUXI   JAYATAMA  is  an  Multi-Channel  Network (MCN) company  under  the Sands Group Indonesia with 9 business units such as Oppo, J&T Express, J&T Cargo, Y.O.U, Makuku, Olike, Jet Commerce, Fullmoon, Tomoro Cafe.

Minimum 1–2 years of experience as a Data Analyst or Business Analyst, preferably in digital, e-commerce, or MCN industries.

Strong business acumen and the ability to translate complex data into actionable insights.

description:

- Memiliki pengalaman minimal 1 tahun di bidang analisis data atau bidang sejenis.

description:

A Machine Learning Engineer train machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) models or implement pretrained models to perform visual recognition tasks, text generation, classification, etc.

Good understanding of ML/DL framework such as Jupyter Notebook, Anaconda, Tensorflow, Keras, Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, MXNet, etc.
Experience working with cloud services platform (AWS or Azure) to build ML/DL pipelines; training (GPU CUDA), evaluating, deploying (SageMaker, Docker container).
Proficiency with Python and basic libraries for ML such as scikit-learn and pandas
Strong working knowledge of ML/DL algorithms (classification, regression, clustering, hyperparameter tuning, etc).
Experience in working with LLM for text and image generation
Preferences:
Having a working knowledge of AI agents is nice to have

Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery(CI/CD) is nice to have
We will also factor in relevant certifications (e.g., AWS, Azure, Coursera)

title: Senior Data Scientist
description:
Role and Responsibilities
Lead and mentor a team of data scientists to deliver cutting-edge analytics solutions that solve real business problems.
Contribute to the deployment of ensemble machine learning methods, deep learning, and advanced optimization techniques to drill into our toughest challenges
Leverage sharp research skills to test hypotheses and draw insights to support our goal of industry-leading, resource-efficient copper mining
Utilize modern cloud technologies, such as Microsoft Azure, to deliver innovative analytics solutions at scale and visualize their impact for leadership
Actively support the build, implementation, and maintenance of practical, analytical assets that effectively solve business problems using statistical methodologies
 Requirements
Minimum Bachelor’s degree in a technical engineering or analytical field (Statistics, Mathematics, etc.) or related discipline.
Minimum 5 years of experience in data science, including at least 3 years leading a Data Science team.
Proven ability to manage, mentor, and grow a high-performing team of data scientists.
Strong expertise in:
Predictive modeling: Linear/Logistic Regression, Random Forest, Gradient Boosting, etc.
Time-Series Analysis, NLP, Anomaly Detection, Survival Analysis.
R and/or Python for data analysis and modeling.
SQL/Hive environments and big data platforms.
Hands-on experience with cloud-based machine learning tools (preferably Azure).
A strategic thinker who can turn data into actionable insights that drive business decisions.
Proficient in English (verbal and written)
 You should have the following attributes:
You are an analytics professional who enjoys grappling with vast data sets, tapped from our long-standing investment in collecting and cleaning data.
You are a quantitative enthusiast who can build complex predictive models and unlock their value through Python, R, SQL and/or other rigorous analytical environments.
You are a tested researcher with a background in breaking down problem statements into their root causes and tailoring solutions based off of your findings.
You have a proven track record of collaborating with business partners to translate operational problems and needs into data-based analytical solutions.
Strong oral and written communication skills in English language.
 Work Environment
Travel required up to 50%; most of the travel goes to mining site.
Position is in a busy, non-smoking office located in Jakarta.
Occasionally work will be performed in a mine, outdoor or manufacturing plant setting.
Must be able to work in a potentially stressful environment.
 Why join Us?
You will be assigned full time and become part of our team at one of the world's biggest mining company.
Working from home during Covid-19 pandemic whenever possible.
We offer very attractive salary and outstanding benefits.
Most of our clients are multinational company which you will be exposed to a large IT environment and valuable experience in international scale projects.
You will always learn new things as our projects always adopt latest technology and best practice available in the market.
Last but not least, we offer a supportive and encouraging environment that puts the emphasis on teamwork. Here, your soft skill (professional relationships, character, attitude) will grow as fast as your technical skill

title: Data Scientist (Analytics)
description:
Company Description
About Grab and Our Workplace
Grab is Southeast Asia's leading superapp. From getting your favourite meals delivered to helping you manage your finances and getting around town hassle-free, we've got your back with everything. In Grab, purpose gives us joy and habits build excellence, while harnessing the power of Technology and AI to deliver the mission of driving Southeast Asia forward by economically empowering everyone, with heart, hunger, honour, and humility.
Job Description
Get to Know the Team
GrabFin Analytics team supports the GrabFin product and business organisations, across Payments Core, Payments Experience, Lending, Insurance, and Kios. Our team is focused on understanding user experiences and partnering with Business, Product, Design, and Tech teams to achieve the right outcomes. We are integral to product development, from understanding user journeys with UX designers, to developing hypotheses, through to post-rollout optimisation.
Get to Know the Role
You will use data to understand user needs and be the de-facto Voice of the Customer (users, driver-partners, merchants, agents) across GrabFin's suite of products. You will leverage data to unveil insights to help launch our products. You will provide thought leadership and generate data-driven hypotheses to solve key Product and Business problems, and drive our GrabFin strategies forward. You will report into Senior Analytics Manager, GrabFin Regional and work onsite in Grab Jakarta South Quarter office.
The Critical Tasks You Will Perform
You will partner with product, design, and engineering teams to derive insights, design experiments, and drive key product decisions.
You will support strategic plans with data insights, performing deep-dives into user behaviour, segmented views and product efficacy.
You will provide tailored analysis for specific products and strategies, define critical business and product metrics, and make regular recommendations for continuous improvements.
You will design, measure, and recommend A/B tests and multivariate experiments, including layout optimisation, UI/UX efficacy, algorithm effectiveness, and API performance.
You will analyse clickstream and transactional data to uncover insights on user behaviour and drive product metrics. You will manage instrumentation for all feature releases within assigned tech families within GrabFin.
You will develop self-serve solutions for stakeholders that are scalable and automated to handle a product environment. You will drive plans involving Large Language Models or Generative Artificial Intelligence.
Qualifications
What Essential Skills You Will Need
You have at least 1+ years of experience in Analytics, Business Intelligence, or Data Science, in a Tech (FinTech or E-Commerce) company.
You have a Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Analytics, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, or related fields.
You are proficient in writing advanced SQL queries and querying large relational databases.
You have hands-on experience with data analysis and programming tools such as Python or R.
You are experienced in data visualisation platforms like PowerBI or D3.js to present findings.
You have experience designing, running, and analysing A/B tests and product experiments, with knowledge of hypothesis testing and the basic principles of Design of Experiments (DoE).
Additional Information
Life at Grab
We care about your well-being at Grab, here are some of the global benefits we offer:
We have your back with Term Life Insurance and comprehensive Medical Insurance.
With GrabFlex, create a benefits package that suits your needs and aspirations.
Celebrate moments that matter in life with loved ones through Parental and Birthday leave, and give back to your communities through Love-all-Serve-all (LASA) volunteering leave
We have a confidential Grabber Assistance Programme to guide and uplift you and your loved ones through life's challenges.
Balancing personal commitments and life's demands are made easier with our FlexWork arrangements such as differentiated hours
What We Stand For At Grab
We are committed to building an inclusive and equitable workplace that provides equal opportunity for Grabbers to grow and perform at their best. We consider all candidates fairly and equally regardless of nationality, ethnicity, race, religion, age, gender, family commitments, physical and mental impairments or disabilities, and other attributes that make them unique.
